Authors: Madyatmadja E.D., Suhartono J., Suliyanti W.N.
Title: Analysis of Community Interest in Using Passport Queue Application
Source title: Proceedings of 2019 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2019
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Computer Science STT PLN, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Madyatmadja, E.D., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Suhartono, J., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Suliyanti, W.N., Computer Science STT PLN, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: This research was conducted to evaluate the benefits of implementing Information and Technology Systems in the Passport Queue Application by the Directorate General of Immigration. Evaluation is carried out to see the community's acceptance of the application and the effectiveness of the application in the process of making passports. The research is based on a set of questionnaires circulated to the public who will make passports at the Immigration office. Based on the data obtained, the author will measure the performance of the passport queue application using a combination of the Technology Acceptance Model (TAM) method and the Unified Theory of Acceptance and Use of Technology (UTAUT). Based on the overall results of testing of the questionnaire data, it can be concluded that the community feels the benefits and ease of use of Passport Queue application. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: community acceptance; passport queue; TAM; UTAUT
Index Keywords: Information management; Surveys; community acceptance; Ease-of-use; Information and technologies; passport queue; Questionnaire data; Technology acceptance model; The unified theory of acceptance and use of technology(UTAUT); UTAUT; Queueing theory

Authors: Chandra Y.U., Kristin D.M., Suhartono J., Sutarto F.S., Sung M.
Title: Analysis of Determinant Factors of User Acceptance of Mobile Payment System in Indonesia (A Case Study of Go-Pay Mobile Payment)
Source title: Proceedings of 2018 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2018
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, School of Information Systems, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Griffith College, Big Data Analytics Department, Dublin, Ireland; Chinese Language and Culture Department, Hankuk University of Foreign Studies, Seoul, South Korea
Authors with affiliations: Chandra, Y.U., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, School of Information Systems, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Kristin, D.M., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, School of Information Systems, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Suhartono, J., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, School of Information Systems, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Sutarto, F.S., Griffith College, Big Data Analytics Department, Dublin, Ireland; Sung, M., Chinese Language and Culture Department, Hankuk University of Foreign Studies, Seoul, South Korea
Abstract: Mobile payment in Indonesia is designed to help the growth of online transport, such as GO-J ek with mobile payment products, which is the GO-Pay mobile payment to make it easier for customers to pay drivers and merchants. The study was carried out for the analysis and evaluation of the acceptance of technology in the mobile payment GO-Pay using the technology acceptance model (TAM). The research was carried out using the quantitative research approach by obtaining 284 active respondents using the GO-Pay mobile payment. The research question in this research is whether GO-Pay as a mobile payment system can be accepted in Indonesia? The result of this research is factor of perceived about usefulness, ease of use, mobility, and the attitude factor can make GO-Pay as mobile payment is acceptable in Indonesia. For the perceived trust, it is not a significant effect, but the effect on perceived trust is perceived reputation, while for the environmental risk it does not affect the perceived reputation. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: adoption; FinTech; go-pay; mobile payment; TAM
Index Keywords: Global system for mobile communications; Information management; Acceptance of technologies; adoption; Analysis and evaluation; FinTech; go-pay; Mobile payment; Mobile payment system; Technology acceptance model; Electronic money

Authors: Suhartono J., Karya S., Candra S.
Title: The utilize of NFC technology for campus library services management
Source title: Proceedings of 2017 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2017
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Management Department, BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Suhartono, J., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Karya, S., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Candra, S., Management Department, BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: In the advent of modern technologies at the present time, library should no longer practice the traditional way of providing information and services. Information Technology should be used in the library to keep abreast of the modern way of providing information. This project will introduce a new diversified way of grabbing the electronic books using the Near Field Communication (NFC). This concept can be applied not only in education institutional but within the whole area in Indonesia. Students/public can grab a copy of Electronic books while they are in Parking Lot, canteen, banks, Train station, or Hospital using the NFC of their mobile phones. In this way, we expand the accessibility of our electronic resources. © 2017 IEEE.

Title: Smart village geographic information system (GIS) development in Indonesia and its analogous approaches
Source title: Proceedings of 2017 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2017
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Bureu of Information and Technology, State Secretariat of the Republic of Indonesia, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Adi, S., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Suhartono, J., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Janawir, Bureu of Information and Technology, State Secretariat of the Republic of Indonesia, Indonesia
Abstract: Indonesia has a big number of villages located at 17,506 islands as the location of various objects of development with the aim of enhancing people welfare. Villages need to have a complete database and an information system that is easily used to serve the needs of data for their development and support public services. The approach in building a database and village information system model can be analogous to a large number of villages and using open source softwares. Based on the literature and statute study, this paper recommends the utilization of information technology and geographic information system (GIS) with a simple, in expencive and easy development model as part of smart village program that enables the village to increase the performance of the village administration, public service, and development. © 2017 IEEE.

Title: Academic competence of Computer Science graduate degree from the employer's perspective
Source title: Proceedings of 2016 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2016
Affiliations: Information System, School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jalan Anggrek, 11530, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Suhartono, J., Information System, School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jalan Anggrek, 11530, Indonesia; Sudirwan, J., Information System, School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jalan Anggrek, 11530, Indonesia
Abstract: This descriptive study aims to determine what competencies are most needed by employers of undergraduate alumne fields of study in Computer Science to meet the needs of the profession. The method used in this research is descriptive method, with a collection of data that originates on the ads required employers, then analysis for the purposes of presenting the data in various categories. The results obtained are maps of professions and competencies most needed employers. By knowing the required professional competence and employers, students can prepare themselves to develop competence and professionalism that is being developed in realizing the ideals and hopes. Likewise, for educational institutions Computer Science can adapt the curriculum to meet the needs of employers, significantly. © 2016 IEEE.
Index Keywords: Computer science; Information management; Competence; Descriptive studies; Educational institutions; employers; Professional; Professional competence; Science graduates; Education

Authors: Perbangsa A.S., Suhartono J., Muljo H.H., Pardamean B.
Title: Research grants management information systems model
Source title: Proceedings of 2016 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2016
Affiliations: School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Accounting, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Master in Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Perbangsa, A.S., School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Suhartono, J., School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Muljo, H.H., Accounting, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Pardamean, B., Master in Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: Currently, the advanced web-based information technology in research and education field are expanding rapidly. But in some activities, such as the management of research, the utilization is still not felt. So the implementation process within the scope of research management at universities is not easy and tends to be slow. The purpose of this study is to determine what features that are needed for the research grants management system and its relationship with the research university roadmap. Research and design that are done in this study focus on designing a model of management information systems research grants. The study was conducted by interviewing and distributing questionnaires to several researchers and managers of research grants in Jakarta, and comparing with literature review. The study also used Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) with Unified Modeling Language notation to design the model. The result of this research is a model of management information systems research grants, which are designed to support operational activities, including the submission, assessment, monitoring, final reporting, and reporting to management and following the university research roadmap as the main contribution of this research. © 2016 IEEE.
Author Keywords: management information system; research grant management; web-based system
